pr_title: [JENKINS-63332] Radio button's move around when clicking them

timeline.message:
[JENKINS - 63332] Radio button's move around when clicking them

When the user clicked the radio button, there's a foldable block would show. But when the block was empty, it would show an empty tr with 2px padding. I try to set 'visibility' to 'hidden' and 'position' to 'absolute' to hide the foldable block that relative to the radio button that was not clicked by user.

timeline.author: daniel-beck

replies.bodyText:
You are right, @daniel-beck . Thanks!
Although I'm testing it further and the position attribute change seems unnecessary here. Will post a new comment.
replies.author: romenrg

timeline.author: romenrg
romenrg

replies.bodyText:
Hello @romenrg , thanks for the suggestion! The reason why I set position to 'absolute' is that if there's something in the foldable block, there will reserve an empty space. See demo

So I change the position to 'absolute' to clear the empty space.

replies.bodyText:

Then ignore my suggestion of removing the position attribute change. Just maybe consider the previous comment of using "static" instead of the "", although that's not a big deal.
